title: Freshwater Fish Safety and Preparation
brief: Safely catch and prepare freshwater fish while avoiding injury from defensive spines.
steps: Step 1: Know that there are no poisonous freshwater fish species.
Step 2: Handle catfish carefully - they have sharp, needlelike protrusions on dorsal fins and barbels.
Step 3: Always cook all freshwater fish thoroughly to kill parasites.
Step 4: Look for fish in eddies near rocks, deep pools, under overhanging brush, and around submerged objects.
Step 5: Fish heavily before storms when they feed actively.
Step 6: Avoid fishing after storms when water is muddy and swollen.
warnings: Catfish spines can inflict painful puncture wounds that quickly become infected.
All freshwater fish must be cooked to eliminate parasites - never eat raw.
Handle fish carefully to avoid cuts from fins and gill covers.
